de.polygonal.ds.Array2<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A two-dimensional array based on a rectangular sequential array.

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(width : Int, height : Int)

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid width or height (debug only).
Creates a two-dimensional array with dimensions width and height.
The minimum size is 2x2.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

appendCol(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or too short (debug only).
Appends the elements of the input array in the range [0, getH()] by adding a new column. n

appendRow(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or too short (debug only).
Appends the elements of the input array in the range [0, getW()] by adding a new row. n

assign(C : Class<T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>) : Void

parameters
C the class to instantiate for each element.
args passes additional constructor arguments to the class C.
Replaces all existing elements with objects of type C. n

inline cellOf(x : T, cell : Array2Cell) : Array2Cell

parameters
cell stores the result.
returns
a reference to cell.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell is null (debug only).
Returns the cell coordinates of the first occurrence of the element x or null if element x does not exist. n

inline cellToIndex(cell : Array2Cell) : Int

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell is null (debug only).
Computes an array index into the linear array from the cell coordinates. 1

clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

Clears this two-dimensional array by nullifying all elements.
The purge parameter has no effect. 1 or n if purge is true

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this two-dimensional array. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this two-dimensional array contains the element x. n

copyCol(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i/j out of range (debug only).
Copies column elements from column i to column j. n

copyRow(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i/j out of range (debug only).
Copies row elements from row i to row j. n

fill(x : T) : Void

Replaces all existing elements with the instance of x. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline get(x : Int, y : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y out of range (debug only).
Returns the element that is stored in column x and row y. 1

inline getArray() : Array<T>

Grants access to the rectangular sequential array storing the elements of this two-dimensional array.
Useful for fast iteration or low-level operations. 1

inline getAt(cell : Array2Cell) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y out of range (debug only).
Returns the element that is stored in column cell.x and row cell.y. 1

inline getAtIndex(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the element at index i. 1

getCol(x : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
a reference to the output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError output is null (debug only).
Copies all elements stored in column x by reference into the output array. n

inline getH() : Int

The height (#rows). 1

inline getIndex(x : Int, y : Int) : Int

Computes an index into the linear array from the x and y index. 1

inline getRow(y : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
a reference to the output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError y out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError output is null (debug only).
Copies all elements stored in row y by reference into the output array. n

inline getW() : Int

The width (#columns). 1

inline inRange(x : Int, y : Int) : Bool

Returns true if x and y are valid.

inline indexOf(x : T) : Int

Returns the index of the first occurrence of the element x or returns -1 if element x does not exist.
The index is in the range [0, size() - 1]. n

inline indexToCell(i : Int, cell : Array2Cell) : Array2Cell

parameters
cell stores the result.
returns
a reference to cell.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError cell is null (debug only).
Transforms the index i into cell coordinates. 1

isEmpty() : Bool

Unsupported operation - always returns false in release mode. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new Array2Iterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this two-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (row-by-row).

prependCol(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or too short (debug only).
Prepends the elements of the input array in the range [0, getH()] by adding a new column. n

prependRow(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or too short (debug only).
Prepends the elements of the input array in the range [0, getW()] by adding a new row. n

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x was nullified.
Nullifies all occurrences of x.
The size is not altered. n

resize(width : Int, height : Int) : Void

parameters
width the new width (minimum is 2).
height the new height (minimum is 2).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid dimensions (debug only).
Resizes this two-dimensional array. n

inline set(x : Int, y : Int, val : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x/y out of range (debug only).
Replaces the element at column x and row y with val. 1

inline setAtIndex(i : Int, val : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Replaces the element at index i with the x. 1

setCol(x : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null or insufficient input values (debug only).
Overwrites all elements in column x with the elements stored in the input array. n

inline setH(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid height (debug only).
Sets the height to x.
The minimum value is 2. 1

setNestedArray(a : Array<Array<T>>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid dimensions of a (debug only).
Copies all elements from the given nested two-dimensional array a into this two-dimensional array.

setRow(y : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError y out of range or input is null or insufficient input values (debug only).
Overwrites all elements in row y with the elements stored in the input array. n

inline setW(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid width (debug only).
Sets the width to x.
The minimum value is 2. 1

shiftE() : Void

Shifts all columns to the east by one position.
Columns are wrapped, so the column at index [getW() - 1] is not lost but prepended to the leftmost column. n

shiftN() : Void

Shifts all rows to the north by one position.
Rows are wrapped, so the row at index 0 is not lost but appended to the bottommost row. n

shiftS() : Void

Shifts all rows to the south by one position.
Rows are wrapped, so row at index [getH() - 1] is not lost but prepended to the topmost row. n

shiftW() : Void

Shifts all columns to the west by one position.
Columns are wrapped so the column at index 0 is not lost but appended to the rightmost column. n

shuffle(?rval : DA<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of this collection by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.< n

inline size() : Int

The number of elements in this two-dimensional array.
Always equals getW() * getH(). 1

inline swap(x0 : Int, y0 : Int, x1 : Int, y1 : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x0/y0 or x1/y1 out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x0, y0 equals x1, y1 (debug only).
Swaps the element at column/row x0, y0 with the element at column/row x1, y1. 1

swapCol(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i/j out of range (debug only).
Swaps column elements at column i with column elements at row j. n

swapRow(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i/j out of range (debug only).
Swaps row elements at row i with row elements at row j. n

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in this two-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (row-by-row).

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in this two-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (row-by-row).

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var array2 = new de.polygonal.ds.Array2<String>(4, 4);
	  array2.walk(function(val:String, x:Int, y:Int):String { return Std.string(x) + "." + Std.string(y); });
	  trace(array2);
	  {Array2, 4x4}
	  |<
	    [0.0][1.0][2.0][3.0]
	    [0.1][1.1][2.1][3.1]
	    [0.2][1.2][2.2][3.2]
	    [0.3][1.3][2.3][3.3]
	  >|

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a Vector.<T> object containing all elements in this two-dimensional array.
Order: Row-major order (row-by-row).

transpose() : Void

Transposes this two-dimensional array. n

walk(process : T -> Int -> Int -> T) : Void

Invokes the process function for each element.
The function signature is: process(oldValue, xIndex, yIndex):newValue n
